title: Using Moon Phases for East-West Direction
brief: Determine east-west direction at night using the illuminated side of the moon.
steps: Step 1: Observe when the moon rises relative to sunset and midnight.
Step 2: If moon rises before sunset, the illuminated side points west.
Step 3: If moon rises after midnight, the illuminated side points east.
warnings: This provides only a rough east-west reference, not precise navigation.
Requires clear sky to see moon phases.
